dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3747 IH: To rename the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Green of Texas (for himself and Mrs. Watson Coleman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To rename the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act, and for other purposes.

section.header: Renaming of Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act

subsection.text: The first section of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1751 note) is amended by striking Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act and inserting National School Lunch Act.
Each of the following provisions of law is amended by striking Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act and inserting National School Lunch Act:

paragraph.text: Sections 3(a)(2)(C), 3(b)(1)(A)(iii)(III), 3(e)(1)(D)(iii)(III), 17(b)(2), and 18(3)(A) of the Commodity Distribution Reform Act and WIC Amendments of 1987 (7 U.S.C. 612c note).
Section 5(l)(2)(D) of the Agriculture and Consumer Protection Act of 1973 (7 U.S.C. 612c note).
Section 10603(b) of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 612c–4(b)).
Section 404 of the Agricultural Act of 1949 (7 U.S.C. 1424).

Section 282(f)(2)(b) of the Act entitled To provide for further research into basic laws and principles relating to agriculture and to improve and facilitate the marketing and distribution of agricultural products, approved August 14, 1946 (7 U.S.C 1638a(f)(2)(b)).
Section 201(a) of the Act entitled An Act to extend the Agricultural Trade Development and Assistance Act of 1954, and for other purposes, approved September 21, 1959 (7 U.S.C. 1431c(a)).
Section 28(a)(1)(B) of the Food Stamp Act of 1964 (7 U.S.C. 2036a(a)(1)(B)).
Section 211(a) of the Agricultural Trade Suspension Adjustment Act of 1980 (title II of the Agricultural Act of 1980) (7 U.S.C. 4004(a)).
Sections 413(b)(2) and 413(b)(3) of the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7633(b)(2), 7633(b)(3)).

Sections 403(c)(2)(C), 422(b)(3), 423(d)(3), 741(a)(1), 742(a), and 742(b)(2)(A) and the caption for section 742 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 (8 U.S.C. 1183a note, 1613(c)(2)(C), 1615(a), 1615(b)(2)(A), 1632(b)(3); 42 U.S.C. 1751 note).
Section 245A(h)(4)(A) of the Immigration and Nationality Act approved June 27, 1952 (8 U.S.C. 1255a(h)(4)(A)).
Section 645(a)(3)(C)(iii) of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (10 U.S.C. 1060a note).
Sections 1154(a)(2)(A)(i), 1154(a)(3)(A), and 2243(b) of title 10, United States Code.
Section 444 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Amendments of 1967 (20 U.S.C. 1232g(b)(1)(K)).

Sections 1113(a)(5)(A), 2221(b)(3)(B)(i), 4611(d)(2)(B), and 7003(b)(2)(B)(i)(III)(bb)(BB) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6313(a)(5)(A), 6641(b)(3)(B)(i), 7261(d)(2)(B), 7703(b)(2)(B)(i)(III)(bb)(BB)).
Section 6122(3) of the America COMPETES Act (20 U.S.C. 9832(3)).
Section 423(j)(2)(D) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C 350l(j)(2)(D)).
Section 3(36)(A)(iv) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102(36)(A)(iv)).
Section 3803(c)(2)(C)(xiii) of title 31, United States Code.
Section 252(i) of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act 1974 (34 U.S.C. 11162(i)).
Section 402a(f)(2)(A) of title 37, United States Code.
Section 113(e)(8)(A) of title 40, United States Code.

Sections 722(b)(3)(A)(i), 722(b)(3)(B)(i), 722(b)(3)(C)(i), 722(b)(3)(D)(i), 722(d)(3), 722(d)(4)(A), 722(d)(5), 722(d)(7), 722(d)(11)(A), and 722(d)(13) of title VII of division N and section 904(a)(6)(B) of title IX of division N of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (42 U.S.C. 1751 note; 47 U.S.C. 1752(a)(6)(B)).
Sections 222(3), 307(b)(1), 307(b)(1)(A), 307(b)(2), and 336(a) of the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010 (42 U.S.C. 1751 note, 1766 note).
Sections 2(4), 125, 301(a), 301(b)(1), 301(a), 301(b)(1), 301(b)(2), and 301(b)(3) of the Healthy Meals for Healthy Americans Act of 1994 (42 U.S.C. 1751 note).
Sections 2(a)(1), 2(d)(1), 2(d)(2), 3(a)(1), and 3(b) of the Keep Kids Fed Act of 2022 (42 U.S.C. 1753 note, 1760 note, 1766 note).
Section 4207(a)(1) of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 (42 U.S.C. 1760 note).
Sections 1107(a), 1107(b), and 1107(c)(1) of the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 (42 U.S.C. 1766 note).
Sections 119(i), 119(j)(1), and 119(j)(3)(C) of the Child Nutrition and WIC Reauthorization Act of 2004 (42 U.S.C. 1766 note).
Section 4(8)(A) of the National Science Foundation Authorization Act of 2002 (42 U.S.C. 1862n note).
Section 3(c)(6)(B) of the STEM Education Act of 2015 (42 U.S.C. 1862q(c)(6)(B)).
Sections 658E(c)(2)(E)(i)(IV) and 658O(b)(3) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981 (42 U.S.C. 9858m(b)(3), 9858c(c)(2)(E)(i)(IV)).
Section 40541(d)(1)(B)(i) of the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (42 U.S.C. 18831(d)(1)(B)(i)).
Subsection (b) of the first section of the Act entitled An Act to extend the application of certain laws to American Samoa, as approved September 25, 1962 (48 U.S.C. 1666(b)).
